author: Staff Reporter
text:
People thronged VOC Park and the Corporation Zoo in the city, cinema theatres and malls for Kaanum Pongal. In rural Coimbatore, the crowd was more at temples, especially at Karuparayan Temple on the Udumalpet Road at Pollachi, and at Malakovil Temple, near Gomangalam.

Along with the weekend crowd, footfall was more than the usual for Kaanum Pongal and police were deployed at these places to regulate the crowd. Hundreds of villagers witnessed the annual kabadi contest for Pongal organised by Kundha Colony Sports Association (KCSA), Karamadai, in which 82 teams from across the State participated.

Around 800 persons participated in the marathon jointly organised by KCSA and Swarga Foundation in association with Vidhya Vikas School, Ganga Hospital, Lone Wolf Biker’s family and Coimbatore Cycling. It was aimed at creating awareness on neurological diseases.

As part of Pongal celebrations, people from 30 villages took part in a Kootanchoru that was organised by Isha Foundation. Eera Nenjam Trust organised a special pongal celebration for people living in the Leprosy Colony at the foothills of Maruthamalai on Saturday.
title: People throng hangout spots for ‘Kaanum Pongal’
